intro: Chionanthus trifidus, commonly known as the three-lobed snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its fragrant, white, bell-shaped flowers that appear in clusters during the spring. The leaves are opposite, simple, and have a distinctive trifid (three-lobed) shape, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. This species is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits.
